page.title: 04HEDGES
page.content: Most of the hedges in the area have two varieties of trees in them indicating an age of 100-150 years. Originally they were used to separate fields of mainly sheep, but now very few farms keep any live-stock. There is a tradition of large fields in the area, one of them having been known as 200 Acre Field for many years. However, with the growth of arable farming, many hedges have been removed. One field examined in the survey was about 1.5km. long and 1km. wide. Along roadside hedges and verges a good number of trees have been planted to replace the mane elms lost through dutch-elm disease.
